Class ChartPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • ChartPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.MouseInputListener

    public class ChartPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements javax.swing.event.MouseInputListener
    This class is part of the SILKin program's GUI. It is modeled after the KAES KinshipEditor by Michael D. Fischer of the Centre for Social Anthropology and Computing, University of Kent. Those portions taken from his code are copyrighted by him; all rights reserved. See his complete copyright statement and terms of re-use in e.g. KinshipEditor.java in this package.

      • getProjectName

        public void getProjectName()
        Called when the 1st person/union is created in any context.
        1. Prompts for a project name of at least 2 characters; failing to get one from User generates a project name of "Temp".
        2. Prompts for the name of the author of the date (i.e. the User's name).
        3. Creates the SILK file for this project and loads the Standard Macros.
        4. Sets various fields in this class and others to reflect the current project.

      • personMenu_MouseExit

        public void personMenu_MouseExit(java.awt.Event event)

      • personMenu_ListSelect

        public void personMenu_ListSelect(java.awt.Event event)
        Called when User makes a selection from the menu of new symbols that can be created on a chart:
        • Female
        • MaleUnion (a marriage or coupling that produces children)
        • Link to an existing person
        • Draw special relationship (UDP)
        Creates the symbol at the location clicked (or nearest grid point if snapToGrid has been selected), and then creates the corresponding object (male, link, etc.) in this context.
        Parameters:
        event - the mouse event that triggered this method

      • findShortestPath

        public static Individual findShortestPath(Individual ind,
                          Family fam)
        Survey ind and all members of fam, and return the person with the shortest path to Ego. In case of a tie, give first preference to 'regular' relationships (e.g. brother, wife), then to 'half' relations (e.g. half-sister), and then 'step' relations (e.g. step-mother). If there is still a tie, prefer ind, then dad, then mom, then eldest kid, etc.
        Parameters:
        ind - person being added to the family
        fam - the family being increased
        Returns:
        person with the shortest path to Ego.

      • removePersonAndRecomputeNodes

        public void removePersonAndRecomputeNodes(Individual ix,
                                 Family fam)
        Remove this person from fam, then modify/remove all nodes in the KinTermMatrix and all dyads in the DyadTMaps that were affected.
        Parameters:
        ix - Individual to be removed.
        fam - Family object from serialNum to remove ix.
